document.heading: Ban on Automated Telephone Dialing Systems for Commercial Solicitation Act of 1991

history.narrative: Law 9-14, the “Ban on Automated Telephone Dialing Systems for Commercial Solicitation Act of 1991,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 9-49, which was referred to the Committee on Public Services. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on April 9, 1991, and May 7, 1991, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on May 17, 1991, it was assigned Act No. 9-34 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
